alert.note: Alert for Adams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:38PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF LEWIS AND SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 915 PM EDT... At 838 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Vanceburg to near Foxport, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Vanceburg, Head of Grassy, Camp Dix, Sandy Springs, Harris, Kinniconick, Tannery, Emerson, Charters, Garrison, Petersville, Stricklett, Glen Springs and Rexton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
